Comments_List: We had a very broad overview of both supervised and unsupervised machine learning methods. We learned mathematical proofs and algorithms. We also learned how to code in R and  which packages to use for specific machine learning technique.
Statistical learning concepts and programming skills.
A lot
Many machine learning skills and their application in R
I had never taken a machine learning course and I learned a lot of interesting strategies and knowledge.
Machine Learning
Data mining and machine learning
The course helped me build a big picture of machine learning and I learned the application of these methods and their pros and cons.
Machine learning skills and techniques.
I developed coding and math skills. It was useful to go through the materials.
Basic machine learning knowledge and applications
Highly useful data mining and machine learning skills.
Methods and algorithms in machine learning, scientific R libraries for programming in ML, natural language processing
Different machine learning methods
Kowledge about supervised and unsupervised machine leaening. IN GENERAL very useful data science skills.
Basic statistical learning and programming in R.

Strength - it is a good overview course for people who want to start learning about machine learning. 

Weakness - The course requires a lot of work. The grading scheme is not very clear, especially participation points.
Only one TF/ULA is helpful in answering homework question

Strength: the homework assignments are practical.
Weakness: some knowledge has not been covered in the class.
I think a weakness was confusing lectures that didn't fully explain the concepts.
It was a great course. I really enjoyed it
The instructor should have posted more reading materials.

The instructor explained stuff pretty clear and the assignments are also designed to be good supplement of what we learned in class. But it would be better if the instructor can provide us some external reference such as what papers we can refer to if we want more mathematical interpretation.
Good learning materials. The course covered a descent amount of topics. Good after-course exercises.
Hope there were more python in the assignments!
Assignments, especially later assignments, were helpful and instructive. I think it could be improved with some editing and also some high level context around how topics may fit together.
Perhaps a little more classroom help could be given on the coding aspect.
This course would be best if it was taught in a CS50 style, where students can focus on watching lectures at home and thes exercise and assignments are there for practice and reinforcement.
The lecture style could be improved

The materials and assignments were clear and useful. 

It would be great if we can get more feedbacks about the assignment and exams. It would be even better if the professor could talk about the essence after each assignment in class.
They should cover more deep learning, reinforcement learning stuff.
Yes
Yes. The knowledge learned is very useful.
I would recommend them this course if they have the time required to complete the projects and they will be able to attend office ours.
Yes, if you are interested in Data Science and Machine Learning, the class will introduce you to many methodologies
Yes. hard core...
Yes
If anyone wants to take some machine-learning course, this course could be a good choice.
Yes. Very challenging but you do learn a lot.
If you have the math + coding skills it's really useful! I thought so. Otherwise it may be tough.
I would recommend.
Yes!
Yes, the concepts are necessary for some advanced classes in remote sensing or other environmental data processing.
Yes. Very interesting and useful class.
The most useful course I've taken so far at Yale, for stat and data science people.
No. There are many classes online much better than this. The workload for people who have no experience in statistics and R programming is too high.
